page.title: 20Sir David Wilkie
page.content: Sir David Wilkie is without doubt the most famous person who ever lived in the village of Pitlessie. He was born on the 18th November 1785 and was brought up in the{manse of {Cults,}a short distance from the village where his{father, the {Reverend David Wilkie,}was minister to the parish. As a boy, David Wilkie went to Pitlessie village school and it is said that even at that time, his talent for drawing was remarkable. His most famous{painting}with regard to Pitlessie is{"Pitlessie Fair". Sketches of buildings which provided the background for this painting can still be identified in the village today. After a highly successful career as a painter to the king, he died at sea at the age of 56 years.
